metadata.title: CVE-2018-1049 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In systemd prior to 234 a race condition exists between .mount and.automount units such that automount requests from kernel may not beserviced by systemd resulting in kernel holding the mountpoint and anyprocesses that try to use said mount will hang. A race condition like thismay lead to denial of service, until mount points are unmounted.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.1
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.1
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.1
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.1
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.1
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.1
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.1
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.1
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.1
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.1
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.1
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.1').
